We want to pay back the TARP money, hell, we didn't need it to begin with, but Sec. Geitner won't allow us to pay it back. Why not? We have the money. All of the larger banks took the money, there was no choice in the matter. The dividend is payable Friday. To date, San Francisco-based Wells (NYSE: WFC) has received $25 billion under the TARP initiative, which is designed to thaw the credit markets and boost the economy. “Since last October when Wells Fargo received this investment from the U.S. Treasury, Wells Fargo has extended more than $225 billion of credit to U.S. consumers and businesses,” said Howard Atkins, chief financial officer. “In the first quarter alone, we originated $101 billion in home mortgages helping 450,000 customers finance a mortgage — almost double the number of customers who did so with us the previous quarter.” >http://www.bizjournals.com/birmingham/stories/2009/05/11/daily40.html Perhaps your bank failed the stress test?
